intro: Actiniopteris dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that exhibit two different forms—some are pinnately divided, while others are entire. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its spores are produced in sori that are arranged along the margins of the fronds. This fern plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen through photosynthesis.
